subject: Re: [junit] master ant script and directories
msgSnippet: ... Pass a parameter/property value when you invoke ? Since this is an Ant question, and not a JUnit question, you might also look for guidance from
messageBody:
khamre wrote:

> When calling an ant-script from a master ant-script in a different
> directory, junit tests in the original script - accessing files -
> lose their bearings. The current path is now that of the calling ant-
> script.
>
> What can I do? Well, if I print out <echo message="${basedir}"/> in
> the called ant-script, I get the correct directory. However, inside
> the junit-tests, the world looks foreign.

Pass a parameter/property value when you invoke <antcall>? Since this is
an Ant question, and not a JUnit question, you might also look for
guidance from an Ant mailing list. We know Ant, but not like /they/ know
Ant.
